description:
Kinoshita Kazuya is a 20-year-old failure of a college student. He managed to kiss his girlfriend once, but was dumped after a month. "Ugh... Damn it. I never want to go through that again."

Completely spiteful, Kazuya uses a certain method to date a girl. He goes to their meeting place and suddenly hears, "You're Kazuya-kun, right?" A beautiful girl brushing her long, black hair behind her ear was there, smiling at him. Her name was Mizuhara Chizuru. Something real is born after just a single rental! A reckless rom-com filled with love and excitement is about to begin!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
hashtag: #彼女お借りします #かのかり
synonyms: I'd like to Borrow a Girlfriend
สะดุดรักยัยแฟนเช่า

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Fake Relationship
tags.description: When two characters enter a fake relationship that mutually benefits one or both involved.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Masturbation
tags.description: Features erotic stimulation of one's own genitalia or other erogenous regions.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Feet
tags.description: Features the sexual depiction or stimulation of a character's feet.

Maeyamada graduated in 2007 from Kyoto University and started his musical career immediately afterwards.

__Genres:__ Alternative rock, Pop rock
__Labels:__ Poppo Express - Epic Records Japan

[Official Site](http://thepeggies.jp/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/the_peggies) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3jNmNbqOSajU-pT36HnTJA) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/the_peggies/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/thepeggiesofficial) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@the_peggies_official) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_peggies) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_peggies)

*the peggies* was a Japanese all-woman rock band from Kawasaki, Kanagawa, Japan, formed in 2011.

On July 8, 2022, the band announced that they would be going on indefinite hiatus in September the same year, following the release of a best of compilation album *MMY* and final tour *"the peggies tour 2022 My White"* concluding on September 30, 2022.

__Members:__
• [Yuuho Kitazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/180282/Yuuho-Kitazawa) (vocals and guitarist, songwriter) • [Twitter](https://x.com/poppoexpress)
• Makiko Ishiwatari (bass) • [Twitter](https://x.com/mega_makiko)
• Miku Onuki (drummer) • [Twitter](https://x.com/minimiku0423)

node.description: __Website | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube__ Introduction: Halca is a Japanese musician affiliated with company Music Ray'n and signed to label Sacra Music. She had a major appearance as the opening act during the CHiCO with HoneyWorks 2017 tour. In 2018 she released her first single called "Kimi no Tonari", which was used as the ending theme for the anime "Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku". Her other appearances have been in anime such as: Ace Attorney, Kaguya-sama: Love is War and We Never Learn!: BOKUBEN Season 2 Biography: Halca started with an interest in music from early childhood. She was heavily inspired when she one day received a copy of the song "Again" by YUI. While in junior high school, she discovered that her home's cable TV had an anime channel, which is also the way she became familiar with anime music in general. She would watch this anime channel on a daily basis, which slowly began to impact her future plans. The biggest impact from the several anime shows she watched in her childhood, were shows such as Cardcaptor Sakura and Toradora!. The anime that had the biggest musical influence ended up being the song "Kiss Kara Hajimaru Miracle" from the anime Steel Angel Kurumi, which became her favorite anime song. She decided to join her school's choir club and broadcast theater club later on to hone her vocal skills, as she started to take an approach to singing herself. After honing her skills in school she officially decided to pursue a career as a musician. Halca had a lot of singing auditions to consider, but the audition that piqued her interest the most was for the Utakatsu! Audition, which focused on anime songs. She decided to participate in the audition for Utakatsu!, and she ended up winning the grand prize in 2013. She didn't let win go to her head, however, as after the winning the audition she continued to train her vocal skills while waiting to make her major debut. In 2017 she was invited by the singer CHiCO, known primarily for her involvement in the group HoneyWorks (alongside Gom, Shito and Yamako), to perform in the latter's 2017 live tour as their opening act. Following her opening act, she performed the song "Kimi no Sora" ("Your Sky"), which was included in a compilation album released to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the online novel publisher Noichigo. She also performed with the song "Resonator", which was used in the original soundtrack for the anime series "Beatless", and she also made a mini-album titled White Disc, which was sold during the HoneyWorks tour. Halca made her major debut later in 2018, with the release of her first single "Kimi no Tonari" ("Next to You"), which was used as the ending theme for the anime Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku. To commemorate the release of her first single, the mini-album White Disc was made available for sale during the single's release event. Her second single "Starting Blue" was released in October 2018, with the title track being used as the ending theme for the second season of the anime Ace Attorney. Her third single "Sentimental Crisis" was released in February 2019, the title track was used as the ending theme for the anime Kaguya-sama: Love is War. Her fourth single "Houkago no Liberty" was released on November 13, 2019, the title track was used as the ending theme to the anime We Never Learn!: BOKUBEN Season 2. (Source: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halca), edited)

Antonio Lucio Vivaldi was an Italian Baroque musical composer, virtuoso violinist, teacher, and Roman Catholic priest. Born in Venice, the capital of the Venetian Republic, he is regarded as one of the greatest Baroque composers, and his influence during his lifetime was widespread across Europe. He composed many instrumental concertos, for the violin and a variety of other musical instruments, as well as sacred choral works and more than forty operas. His best-known work is a series of violin concertos known as the Four Seasons.
__Yasuhira Sakai__ is a Japanese music producer.
**Hiroyuki Aoi** is a Japanese producer and publicity manager.

Hiroo Maruyama is a producer working for Mainichi Broadcasting System (MBS).

He joined Mainichi Broadcasting in 1999. Was transferred later to the Tokyo office and took over duties relating to the production of animation broadcasts. He was responsible for production on series like Gundam Seed, Gundam Seed Destiny and Full Metal Alchemist, all part of the 6:00pm Saturday timeblock, which gained wide popularity.
